padding: 14px 11px 10px 8px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat;" data-cellinner="cell2"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell2" data-innereditablearea="cell2"><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">EXPERT OPINION: A CALL TO ACTION: TREATMENT FOR ADOLESCENTS WHO HAVE ENGAGED IN ILLEGAL SEXUAL BEHAVIOR</font></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Part two of a three-part series about evidence-based practices for individuals who have committed sexual offenses. Following August’s focus on adult treatment practices and whether such treatments actually “work,” Amanda M. Fanniff, Ph.D., Associate Professor at Palo Alto University, focuses on adolescents who have committed sexual offenses. As with part one of the series, we start by asking the question, “How do we measure treatment in this area?”</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">To read this column, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/ExpertOpinion10_19.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 20px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 22px;">LEGAL UPDATE: ASSESSING THREATS OF SELF-DIRECTED VIOLENCE AND DUTIES OF CARE WITHIN HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS: NGUYEN V. MASSACHUSETTS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (2018)</font></strong></p><p><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Whereas threat assessment professionals in the United States and Canada may well be aware of case law, other legal standards, and their professional responsibilities regarding assessing and managing risk of violence toward others, fewer may be as familiar with sources of authority regarding self-directed violence threat assessment. It may be reassuring to know that our professional responsibilities related to assessing and managing other- and self-directed violence are somewhat analogous, and the courts have historically, as well as more recently, underscored this view.</font></p><p><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">To read more about this, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/LegalUpdate10_19.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">CAREER CORNER</font></strong></p><p><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">The Career Corner is intended to highlight the individuals who work at the intersection of law and psychology, where they come from, how they got there and how their experiences influence their research, teaching, and/or practice. data-innereditablearea="cell3"><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong><font color="#000000" face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">PRESIDENTIAL COLUMN</font></strong></font></strong></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><img width="200" alt="Jennifer Groscup" src="./oct19_files/Jennifer-Groscup-300x300.jpg"><br></font></font></p><p align="center" style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><em>Jennifer Groscup</em></font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">It was an honor to be elected President of AP-LS, and I am very much looking forward to working with all of you in the upcoming year on our organization. The first thing I want to do is tell you about my Presidential initiative: Embracing Leadership: Developing Skills for Your Career Evolution. This is a leadership training program for our members that will provide participants with the skills and the opportunities to become leaders within our Division and beyond. Based on surveys of our membership and on the surveys done on specific subgroups within our membership (ECPs, Student Section, etc.), there appears to be a high level of interest in leadership development. Many members have expressed the desire to be involved in leadership, but they feel it is difficult to “break into” leadership in the Division. This perception is one of many barriers to leadership for our members, and this feeling is not limited to leadership within the Division.</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">To read the rest of this column, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/PresidentialColumnOct19.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.&nbsp;</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font color="#000000" face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong><font color="#000000" face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">DIVISION 41 CALL FOR REVIEWERS: APA 128th 2020 ANNUAL CONVENTION</font></strong></font></strong></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font color="#000000" face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">We are looking for reviewers to review submitted programming proposals for the 128<sup>th</sup> Annual Convention of the American Psychological Association to be held Aug 6 – 9, 2020 in Washington, DC.<br>Proposals will be in the following formats: symposia, skill-building sessions, discussions, data blitzes, and posters.</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Student reviewers are welcome!</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">For more information, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/2020Division41CallforReviewersAPA.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">The deadline to sign up to be a reviewer is</font> <strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">December 2, 2019</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">.</font></strong></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></strong></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">CALL FOR APPLICATIONS: EMBRACING LEADERSHIP: DEVELOPING SKILLS FOR YOUR CAREER EVOLUTION</font></strong></strong></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">The American Psychology-Law Society is starting a leadership development program,</font></font> <font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">and we encourage any and all members to apply for this exciting opportunity!</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Embracing Leadership is designed to provide our members with practical training in</font></font> <font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">leadership and with leadership opportunities within AP-LS. The goals of the program</font></font> <font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">are:</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">1) Provide training for interested members in a variety of leadership skills that</font></font> <font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">could benefit their careers broadly</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">2) Cultivate interest in leadership within the Division</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">3) Provide leadership opportunities within the Division</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">4) Prepare our members to take on leadership challenges</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">For more information, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/EmbracingLeadershipCallForApplications2019.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Applications are due</font> <font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong>November 15, 2019</strong></font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">.</font></font><strong><font style="font-size: 24px;"><br></font></strong></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font style="font-size: 24px;"><br></font></font></strong></strong></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font style="font-size: 24px;">APA COMMITTEE ON LEGAL ISSUES (COLI) SEEKS NEW MEMBERS</font></font></strong></strong><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 13px;"><br></font></strong></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">The APA Committee on Legal Issues (COLI) is one of the most pertinent ways for AP-LS members to become better involved in APA governance and leadership activities. COLI makes recommendations, prepares and issues reports, and educates APA and psychologists about psycho-legal issues and to promote the field of psychology as it interfaces with the law. COLI does not serve as legal counsel to or form an attorney-client relationship with the APA or the Board of Directors. Instead, COLI has a primary responsibility for serving as a “think tank” for the Board of Directors on psycho-legal issues.&nbsp;</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Nominations are sought for one JD/PhD position and two PhD or PsyD positions. The term of service for all positions is Jan. 1, 2020-Dec. 31, 2022. COLI members must also be APA members. Applications should include (1) a brief statement of no more than 300 words detailing qualifications, and (2) a current curriculum vitae. Nominees' materials will be reviewed by COLI and COLI will send their recommendations to the Board of Directors for review.</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">For more information, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/RevisedCOLICallforNominations09182019.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Applications are due <strong>October 8, 2019</strong> to <a href="mailto:COLInominations@apa.org">COLInominations@apa.org</a>.&nbsp;</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><br></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" size="5"></font></strong><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><br></p><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font><p><font style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font></p><div>  <div style="line-height: 18px;">    <div style="line-height: 18px;"></div>  </div></div></div></td>													</tr>												</tbody></table>											</td>										</tr>									</tbody></table>								</td><td width="200" align="" class="cellContainer cell4Container" valign="top">									<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">										<tbody><tr>											<td class="cellOuter" valign="top" style="padding: 0px;" data-cellouter="cell4">												<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" data-cellborder="1">													<tbody><tr>														<td class="cellInner" valign="top" style="background-position: 0% 0%; padding: 14px 8px 0px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat;" data-cellinner="cell4"><div id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell4" data-innereditablearea="cell4"><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">AAFP DISSERTATION GRAND AWARDS</font></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><span style="background-color: white;"><font color="#000000" face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">The American Academy of Forensic Psychology (AAFP) is pleased to announce the following individuals have been awarded Dissertation Grant Awards for 2019. The application process was competitive and the following award recipients were especially impressive.&nbsp;</font></span><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font><font style="font-size: 16px;"><u>Keisha April</u>, Drexel University, $1,500.00.</font></font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Dissertation Title:&nbsp; Let’s “Talk” About the Police: The Role of Race and Intergenerational Transmission of Police Legitimacy Attitudes in the Legal Socialization of Youth</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font><font style="font-size: 16px;"><u>Emilie Picard</u>, Fordham University: $1,494.00.</font></font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Dissertation Title:&nbsp; Neuropsychological Impairment among Men with Pedophilic Disorder Charged with Possession of Child Pornography</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font><font style="font-size: 16px;"><u>Lauren Meaux</u>, University of Alabama, $1,050.00.</font></font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Dissertation Title:&nbsp; Right Wing Authoritarianism and Psycholegal Opinions in MSO Evaluations</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font><font style="font-size: 16px;"><u>Alexis Humenik</u>, Baylor University, $955.00.</font></font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Dissertation Title:&nbsp; The Role of Executive Dysfunction and Substance Use In Intimate Partner Violent Offenders</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Congratulations to each of these recipients as they stood out in a competitive applicant field. We are confident that they will make substantial contributions to the field of forensic psychology.</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">CALL FOR SUBMISSIONS: APA 2020</font></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Ready to present your exciting and interesting work in the area of psychology and the law? Submit programming for the 128<sup>th</sup> Annual Convention of the American Psychological Association to be held Aug 6 – 9, 2020 in Washington, DC!<br>&nbsp;<br>The American Psychology – Law Society (APA Division 41) invites presentations from any area that involves the intersection of psychology and the law (e.g., practice, teaching, research, policy, law, community outreach).</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">For more information about this, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/2020CallforSubmissions.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Proposals must be submitted by <strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">December 2, 2019 (5pm EST).</font></strong></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></strong></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">CALL FOR COLLABORATIVE PROPOSALS: APA 2020</font></strong></strong></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Hello from your 2020 APA Division 41 Co-chairs!</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">We would like to inform you about the unique opportunities presented by Collaborative Programs at APA. APA defines a Collaborative Program as “a cohesive session that showcases multiple perspectives and involves more than one core area of psychology, i.e., science, practice, education, public interest.” These are separate submissions from the usual call for symposia within Division 41, and they are also due earlier (</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong>October 11, 2019</strong></font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">).</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">For more information, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/2020CallforCollaborativeProposals.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font></font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">BETH ROM RYMER SCHOLARSHIPS</font></strong></font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Up to nine $5,000 scholarships to support training in psychopharmacology programs.&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">The Beth N. Rom-Rymer Scholarships provide support to both graduate students and practicing, licensed psychologists to complete their training in psychopharmacology programs, which adhere to the APA model curriculum of didactic training in clinical psychopharmacology. The purpose of the scholarships is to encourage talented psychologists, with recognized leadership skills, and with demonstrated passion for growing the field, to become prescribing psychologists, engaged in providing the highest caliber, comprehensive, integrated care to the most at-risk members of the community. Preference will be given to those applicants who are committed to working with the underserved. Approximately half of the scholarships are intended for predoctoral graduate students and approximately half for practicing licensed psychologists at all career levels.&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">For more information, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/BethRomRymerScholarships.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">The deadline for applications is <strong>February 1, 2020</strong>.</font></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></font></p><p style="line-height: 22px;"><font color="#000000" style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 24px;">MISCARRIAGES OF JUSTICE, TENTH ANNUAL ISSUE 2019-2020</font></strong></font></p><p><font color="#000000" face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Miscarriages of Justice is a special interdisciplinary issue of Albany Law School’s Albany Law Review, published in collaboration with the University at Albany’s School of Criminal Justice. This annual issue is composed of articles that integrate legal scholarship with social science and/or policy perspectives, and it focuses on problems within or related to the criminal justice system. The tenth annual issue anticipates publication in Spring of 2020. The theme for the 2019–2020 issue is: “Justice Delayed is Justice Denied: A Look at the Influence of Exonerations on Post-Conviction Proceedings in our Legal System and Beyond”.</font></p><p><font color="#000000" face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">For more information, please click <a href="https://ap-ls.wildapricot.org/resources/EmailTemplates/2019_10%20October%20AP-LS%20Newsletter/2020MiscarriagesofJusticeCallforPapers(Exonerate).pdf">here</a>.</font></p><p><font color="#000000" style="font-size: 16px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">Submissions are due</font> <strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">October 31, 2019</font></strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif">.</font></font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font></p><br><table width="1060" style="line-height: 18px;
